Key Match Events: James, with the Lakers trailing by three, intentionally missed a free throw but failed to secure the rebound, allowing the Suns to seal the win with free throws from Bradley Beal.
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James had a challenging game, entering the fourth quarter with only seven points and finishing with an NBA-record streak of 1,226 games with at least 10 points.
Anthony Davis was a key contributor with 29 points and 15 rebounds, continuing to demonstrate his value as the primary offensive option for the Lakers.
Kevin Durant's late-game strategy of 'hunting' smaller defenders was pivotal to the Suns' comeback, allowing him to score crucial points over mismatched defenders.
JJ Redick acknowledged that he could have adjusted the defense earlier in the fourth quarter to better handle Durant's strategy, taking responsibility for the loss.
Others: The Lakers' strong start to the season (3-1) ties for their best in the LeBron James era, reminiscent of their championship-winning season in 2019-20.
